items.title: Texas A&M System declines to reinstate fired lecturer despite faculty panel’s findings
bullets: • Melissa McCoul was fired in September after a video of her teaching about gender identity in a children’s literature class went viral
• A faculty appeals panel unanimously concluded that her dismissal was not justified
• The university system deferred the decision to the university system
• McCoul's attorney confirmed to The Texas Tribune that this sequence of events occurred

items.title: Being Santa Claus is a year-round calling
bullets: • Professional Santas tend to fall into one of three categories: portly white men with natural white beards

• Co-author Christina Hymer of the University of Tennessee got the idea for the study during the COVID pandemic

• Economists say this will drive housing costs up, even as Texas officials focus on bringing such costs down

items.title: Trump administration weighing new South Texas land exchange with Elon Musk’s SpaceX

• The deal would give SpaceX the land in exchange for 692 acres of land it owns elsewhere in the county, some of it 20 miles away from the refuge

items.title: [Editorial] The Horror of Legibility: Queer Visibility and Family in Mae Martin’s WAYWARD
bullets: • Mae Martin’s Wayward opens with a kind of horror that doesn’t announce itself
• From Tall Pines Academy to the too-perfect small town that hosts it, everything looks ordinary enough to pass inspection
• But the real danger in Wayward is never the setting; it's the gaze that saturates it
• Alex, a trans police officer played by Martin embodies the exhausted labor of visibility

items.title: China just carried out its second reusable launch attempt in three weeks
bullets: • The first Long March 12A rocket, roughly the same height and diameter of SpaceX’s workhorse Falcon 9, lifted off from the Jiuquan Satellite Launch Center at 9:00 pm EST Monday (02:00 UTC Tuesday) The rocket's methane-fueled first stage booster hurtled through the atmosphere at supersonic speed
• The booster failed to complete a braking burn to slow down for landing at a prepared location near the Gobi Desert

items.title: FCC’s import ban on the best new drones starts today

• The list was already populated by Kaspersky, ZTE, Huawei, and others
• People can still use Chinese-made drones they already own, but the FCC won't approve any new devices from companies that aren't based in the US

items.title: Indigenous groups fight to save rediscovered settlement site on Texas coast
bullets: • The rediscovery of an ancient settlement site has spurred a campaign for its preservation by Native American groups in South Texas
• The site sits on several hundred acres of undeveloped scrubland, criss-crossed by wildlife trails with almost a half mile of waterfront
• It is among the last undisturbed tracts of land on almost 70 miles of shoreline

items.title: ‘They’re scared of us now’: how co-investment in a tropical forest saw off loggers
bullets: • There are no roads through the Darién Gap, a vast impenetrable forest that stretches the width of the land bridge between South and Central America, but there is almost no way through it
• Like tropical forests all over the world, it has been steadily shrinking, with at least 15% lost to logging, mining and cattle ranching in two decades
• Panama has mounted a surprising fightback that could offer hope to the rest of the world’s forests

items.title: The deep ocean has a missing link and scientists finally found it
bullets: • Researchers at Woods Hole Oceanographic Institution have uncovered why big predators like sharks spend so much time in the oceanâs twilight zone
• The answer lies with mid-sized fish such as the bigscale pomfret, which live deep during the day and rise at night to feed
• Using satellite tags, researchers tracked these hard-to-study fish for the first time

items.title: Trump’s war on offshore wind faces another lawsuit
bullets: • Dominion Energy filed suit against the Trump administration over its decision to pause federal leases for large offshore wind projects
• The move puts a sudden stop to five wind farms already under construction, including Dominion’s Coastal Virginia Offshore Wind project
• The suit also argues that the “sudden and baseless withdrawal of regulatory approvals by government officials” threatens the ability of developers to construct large-scale infrastructure projects
